column1: Bone pain can occur with injuries or conditions such as: - Cancer in the bones (primary malignancy) - Cancer that has spread to the bones (metastatic malignancy) - Disruption of blood supply (as in sickle cell anemia) - Infected bone (osteomyelitis) - Infection - Injury (trauma) - Leukemia - Loss of mineralization (osteoporosis) - Overuse - Toddler fracture (a type of stress fracture that occurs in toddlers)
See your health care provider if you have bone pain and do not know why it is occurring.
